full_summary:
===============

### Title

EW699-230708 Akpatok Island Remediation

### Reference
WS3835228419-Doc3835277447 

### Solicitation Number
WS3835228419

### Tender Status
Cancelled

### Closing Date
Tuesday, March 6, 2023, 2:00 PM EST

### Brief Description
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) cancels this solicitation. 

### Overview
As a response to a previously posted Request for Proposal (RFP) for the remediation of the former oil and gas exploration site on Akpatok Island, PWGSC is cancelling this solicitation. If you are an interested contractor, please refer to the cancellation notification and any other instructions provided in the RFP. PWGSC is not responsible for notifying every interested bidder. 

### Contract Description
The remediation efforts include minor demolition of structures, removal and disposal of hazardous and non-hazardous waste, and the excavation of contaminated soil. 

### End User
Department of Public Works and Government Services

### Contact Info
Danielle Graham, Danielle (SPAC/PSPC)
* danielle.graham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

(No phone/fax information is provided)

### Related Documents
All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by Tuesday, March 6, 2023, 2:00 PM EST.

### Notes
Note from the writer to the reviewers, the original text was not a tender notice, but an amendment to changes to an already cancelled tender, but the extra details regarding the bid submission and cancellation time were interesting. 

Note: 261 words. 
I added a cancel notice, to state the obvious, and followed the bid submission date, time and the context was removed in response to cancellation. 
The remaining fields; contractor, bid submission, cancellation date were provided as per the 'original message.' 

As always, everyone, please provide feedback on my submission. 

Thank you in advance. I look forward to hearing your thoughts on this endeavor. 

William Erwin Woods, CLIPP Senior Content Specialist. 
I will keep in mind your feedback in the reinforcement of writing-purpose critically well, incorporating business context, efficiency and subtlety for positive outcomes.
